description.narrative: Health facilities in 29 districts have appropriate technology and qualified human resources to provide equitable HIV prevention, care and treatment by 2018, which contributes to Adolescents And Hiv/Aids, Care And Treatment Of Children Affected By Hiv And Aids, Hiv Prevention, Pmtct And Infant Male Circumcision, Protect, Care And Support Children And Families Affected By Hiv, Treatment And Care Of Children Living With Hiv. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 90% of children, adolescents and pregnant and lactating women utilize equitable, gender-sensitive HIV prevention, care and treatment services by 2018

description.narrative: Scaling up of laboratory technologies, backed up by capacity building, mentoring and supportive supervision, have strengthened diagnosis of HIV positive children, adolescents, pregnant and lactating women and increased timely initiation on ART. | Status:Met | As-of Date:26/07/2018
